column4: how can I install binary video drivers for nvidia from the command line?
oh, woops....lspci says that the video card is actually an integrated intel
wonder why it's not installing then?
err, not working, rather...it works every now and then, but it's not consistent

whenever I boot, the screen goes black after the grub esc message, stays black for an unusual amount of time, and eventually the screen changes and a "loading" mouse cursor appears, but just for a few seconds. the screen then goes scrambled and it goes black and stays that way.
unable to open display (null)
I can when I'm in the root console, but not once it's booted up into X
should I perhaps reinstall the machine?
but it was a clean install, so it seems strange that I would have the problems
what problems?
i had an issue where ttys in /etc/event.d/ where setup wrong on new install
it froze at initializing local
edit them. check em out they should look like this: exec /sbin/getty 38400 tty1    then on next line respawn.  they were all screwed up
basically i had not getty logins but x came up
that top stuff is right. its just the getty thing and respawn should be after it
i will pastebin one sec
drove me crazy :)  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/25645/
just do it for all the ttys
not just 1
if I only do it for 1 then it still won't work?
alt-ctrl-f1 will
change em all
they are wrong
